item.title: How to write a kubectl plugin using Golang
item.description: Table of contents Introduction Decide which plugin you want to develop Clone the Krew plugin template Implementing the plugin Installing the plugin Releasing the plugin on Github Publishing the plugin on Krew Introduction Have you ever thought about extending kubectl cli to add a missing functionality? Actually, extending kubectl is reasonably easy, in this blog post Iâ€™ll explain how you can write your own plugin with Go. item.title: About
item.description: Who am I? My name is Jean-Philippe Bond, I am a software engineer with over 12 years experience designing and building software solutions. I’m currently working as a software consultant with a primary focus on cloud-native architectures, CI/CD and everything related to containers and Kubernetes.
